description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
On average it takes 5 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

contents.description: Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.
This section asks for information about your business's exporting activities and any related challenges.
This section asks for information about your business's importing activities and any related challenges.
This section asks for information about CE (Conformity with European health, safety, and environment) and UKCA markings.

These are markings that apply to a wide range of consumer and industrial goods such as toys, personal protective equipment, and construction products. The markings signal that products are fit to be placed on the GB market.
This section asks for information about:

list: the availability of materials, goods and services within the EU
the availability of materials, goods and services within the UK
the main concern to your business

contents.description: This section asks for information about sending goods from GB to Northern Ireland, as well as from Northern Ireland to GB, and any related challenges.
Include
Goods sent to:
GB means ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.
This section asks for information about your workforce such as:
This section asks for information about how your business has been affected by recent industrial action.

The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This section asks for general information on your business's trading status.

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}'s trading status?

description:
You can interpret 'trading' as 'operating'.

Only select 'paused trading' if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

contents.description: This section asks for information about your business's exporting activities and any related challenges.

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}'s exporting status?

options.label: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
options.value: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export

options.label: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export
options.value: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

in: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

question.title: How did your business's exporting in March 2023 compare with this calendar month last year?
How did your business's cost of exporting in March 2023 compare with this calendar month last year?
How did the time spent on exporting in March 2023 compare with this calendar month last year?
Did your business experience an increase in any of the following exporting challenges in March 2023, compared with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: For example, a business experienced an increase in additional paperwork compared to the previous calendar month.

options.label: Additional paperwork
options.description: For example, conformity assessments, customs declarations, health and rules-of-origin certifications

options.label: Change in transportation costs
options.description: For example, freight rates

options.label: Customs duties or levies
options.description: Including VAT and other taxes

options.label: Destination countries changing their border restrictions
options.value: Destination countries changing their border restrictions

options.label: Finding information on how to export
options.value: Finding information on how to export

options.label: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.value: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.description: For example, containers, warehouse capacity or wooden pallets

options.label: Reduced demand for products and services
options.value: Reduced demand for products and services

options.label: Time taken for checks at the border
options.value: Time taken for checks at the border
options.description: For example, documentary or physical checks

options.label: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications
options.value: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications

options.label: Did not experience an increase in any exporting challenges
options.value: Did not experience an increase in any exporting challenges

question.title: What was the main cause of these exporting challenges?

options.label: End of the EU transition period
options.value: End of the EU transition period

options.label: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period
options.value: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period

contents.description: This section asks for information about CE (Conformity with European health, safety, and environment) and UKCA markings.

These are markings that apply to a wide range of consumer and industrial goods such as toys, personal protective equipment, and construction products. The markings signal that products are fit to be placed on the GB market.

question.title: Does your business manufacture, import, or distribute products that require either a CE marking or the new UKCA marking?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'CE' and 'UKCA' markings

contents.description: The UKCA (UK Conformity Assessed) marking is a new UK product marking that is used for goods being placed on the market in GB. It covers most goods that previously required the CE (Conformity with European health, safety, and environment) marking.

options.label: Yes, we manufacture products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we manufacture products that need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: No, we do not manufacture, import or distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: No, we do not manufacture, import or distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking

blocks.page_title: Products that require CE or UKCA marking

any-in: Yes, we manufacture products that need a CE or UKCA marking
Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking
Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking

question.title: Is your business aware that most CE marked products need to be UKCA marked from 1 January 2025?
description: In November 2022, it was announced that the deadline for businesses to apply UKCA markings will be extended by two years, from 31 December 2022 to 31 December 2024, for most products.

question.title: Is your business using, or intending to use, the UKCA marking by 1 January 2025?
description: In November 2022, it was announced that the deadline for businesses to apply UKCA markings will be extended by two years, from 31 December 2022 to 31 December 2024, for most products.

options.label: Not aware of, or do not know how to meet, requirements for the UKCA
options.value: Not aware of, or do not know how to meet, requirements for the UKCA

options.label: Not using the UKCA marking, but plan to by 1 January 2025
options.value: Not using the UKCA marking, but plan to by 1 January 2025

options.label: Will not use UKCA marking, as not relevant to our products or business
options.value: Will not use UKCA marking, as not relevant to our products or business

in: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

question.title: In the last 12 months, has your business sold goods or services to customers in other UK nations?

contents.description: Exclude trade within the same UK nation

definitions.title: What we mean by 'other UK nations'

contents.description: This refers to selling to customers in a different nation within the UK. The four nations that make up the UK are England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

blocks.page_title: Selling to customers in other UK nations

contents.description: Exclude trade within the same UK nation

definitions.title: What we mean by 'other UK nations'

contents.description: This refers to selling to customers in a different nation within the UK. The four nations that make up the UK are England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

options.value: Challenges related to the Northern Ireland Protocol

options.label: Differences in rules or regulations
options.description: Excluding challenges related to the Northern Ireland Protocol

options.value: Business did not experience any challenges
